alert.note: Alert for Henderson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 5:46PM EST until January 09 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Henderson County in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 538 PM EST, Rain gauges measured heavy rainfall of 4 to 6 inches across much of Henderson County over the past 18 hours. Although the rain has largely ended early this evening, runoff from the heavy rainfall continues to produce flooding and road closures around the county. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hendersonville, Mills River, Fletcher, Flat Rock, Etowah, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Saluda, Chimney Rock Village, Dupont State Forest, Bat Cave, Jones Gap State Park, Chimney Rock State Park, Valley Hill, East Flat Rock, Horse Shoe and Dana. - Flooding will continue along Mud Creek and Bat Fork Creek in Hendersonville. Flooding will impact William H. King Memorial Park and the Oklawaha Greenway, as well as locations near South Center Plaza. Flooding from these tributaries may approach first floor levels in nearby buildings. Flooding is also likely along Dana Road and Tracy Grove Road near Four Seasons Boulevard. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Continue to heed all road closures. When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
